field.name: Person
field.definition: an entity responsible for making contributions to the content of the resource

otherPractice.practice: Role: choose the person's role (most often author or editor).

Order: corresponds to the order the person appears in on the resource (it doesn't matter if you enter them in as the last person so long as their order = 1). If order is different on the resource and its landing page, go with the resource.
UCARid: this is optional. Do not erase if it was already entered. Using the "Affiliation Helper" will automatically enter it.
ContactInfo: this is optional. Do not erase if it was already entered.

Affiliation: this is only for UCAR persons. Using the "Affiliation Helper" will autofill this field. Make sure you include the instDivision as well as the instName--do your best to obtain this information. Only use the instProject for Archives records. If you're Q/A'ing a record which includes UCAR affiliation information when the resource itself does not cite the person as UCAR-affiliated at the time of publication, check with the author or administrator who submitted the record. If you can confirm their UCAR affiliation, leave the affiliation information, mark the record as UCAR authorship under Classify:collaboration, and enter a Rights:notesToCurator "UCAR affiliation and collaboration confirmed." If you cannot confirm the UCAR affiliation, leave the affiliation information but switch the Classify:collaboration to "Unspecified."
For names of non-UCAR persons, enter as much information as the resource gives you. For people who work at UCAR, do your best to find their complete name.
If entering an initial for a name, don't put a period after it--this will happen automatically. If the initials are hyphenated, do put periods (i.e. H.-Y.).
Do not enter titles or honorifics, such as Dr., Mrs., etc.

If there is a discrepancy between the name on the resource and the UCAR people database, defer to the UCAR people database (for example, if the resource says 'Bill Doe' and the database says 'William Doe', use William Doe). Then use the full name on the resource as the publishingName (in this case, 'Bill Doe').
